title: 109_hr23
content: The Act titled "Belated Thank You to the Merchant Mariners of World War II Act of 2005" introduces a monthly benefit for World War II Merchant Mariners and survivors under Title 46, United States Code. This includes amendments to Chapter 112 of the code to provide burial and cemetery benefits, as well as a new subchapter for monthly benefits. The Act "Belated Thank You to the Merchant Mariners of World War II Act of 2005" introduces a monthly benefit of $1,000 for World War II Merchant Mariners and their surviving spouses. The benefit is exempt from taxation and requires the surviving spouse to have been married to the veteran for at least 1 year. The Act "Belated Thank You to the Merchant Mariners of World War II Act of 2005" provides a monthly tax-exempt benefit of $1,000 for World War II Merchant Mariners and their surviving spouses. Qualified service for this benefit includes serving as a crewmember of a vessel operated by specific administrations between December 7, 1941, and December 31, 1946, in designated waters. Sec. 11207 outlines the documentation requirements for qualified service under the "Belated Thank You to the Merchant Mariners of World War II Act of 2005." Applicants must submit an application for a service certificate to the Secretary of Transportation or the Secretary of Defense, depending on their service branch. The service certificate is issued by the respective Secretary upon receipt of the application. The Secretary will issue a certificate of honorable service to applicants who engaged in qualified service under section 11206 and meet the standards within 1 year of application. The standards for service determination align with those for honorable discharges under the GI Bill Improvement Act of 1977. In this subchapter, the term 'surviving spouse' is defined as in section 101 of title 38, with 'veteran' including those who performed qualified service as specified in section 11206. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs is authorized to appropriate necessary funds for this subchapter. Amendments are made to section 11201 of title 46 to reflect the change to 'subchapter'. Chapter 112 of title 46, United States Code is amended by inserting a new item at the beginning. Chapter 112 of title 46, United States Code is amended by adding a new subchapter ii for monthly benefits for qualified service, including documentation and definitions. This subchapter will take effect for payments starting from the enactment date, regardless of the application date. Additionally, benefits for World War II Merchant Mariners under Title II of the Social Security Act are addressed. The Social Security Act is amended to include benefits for active military or naval service, which now covers members of the United States merchant marine who were crewmembers of vessels operated by specific administrations during wartime. The Social Security Act is amended to include benefits for active military or naval service, covering members of the United States merchant marine who served on vessels operated by specific administrations during wartime, under contract to the Government and serving the Armed Forces. The amendment made by subsection (a) applies to benefits for months starting after the enactment of this Act.
